aria_content_in_landmark.0: All content must reside within an element with a landmark role
aria_content_in_landmark.Fail_1: Content is not within a landmark element

element_id_unique.0: Element 'id' attribute values must be unique within a document
element_id_unique.Fail_2: The <{0}> element has the id "{1}" that is already in use

style_color_misuse.0: Combine color and descriptive markup to convey information
style_color_misuse.Potential_1: Verify color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information

style_highcontrast_visible.0: Windows high contrast mode must be supported when using CSS to include, position or alter non-decorative content
style_highcontrast_visible.Manual_1: Confirm Windows high contrast mode is supported when using CSS to include, position or alter non-decorative content

aria_role_redundant.0: An explicitly-assigned ARIA role should not be redundant with the implicit role of the element
aria_role_redundant.fail_redundant: The explicitly-assigned ARIA role "{0}" is redundant with the implicit role of the element <{1}>

aria_role_valid.0: ARIA roles must be valid for the element to which they are assigned
aria_role_valid.Fail_1: The ARIA role '{0}' is not valid for the element <{1}>

aria_attribute_valid.0: ARIA attributes should be valid for the element and ARIA role to which they are assigned
aria_attribute_valid.Fail_invalid_implicit_role_attr: The ARIA attributes "{0}" are not valid for the element <{1}> with implicit ARIA role "{2}"

aria_navigation_label_unique.0: Each element with "navigation" role must have a unique label that describes its purpose
aria_navigation_label_unique.Fail_1: Multiple elements with "navigation" role do not have unique labels

element_tabbable_unobscured.0: When an element receives focus, it is not entirely covered by other content
element_tabbable_unobscured.potential_obscured: Confirm that when the element receives focus, it is not covered or, if covered by user action, can be uncovered without moving focus

element_tabbable_visible.0: A tabbable element should be visible on the screen when it has keyboard focus
element_tabbable_visible.potential_visible: Confirm the element should be tabbable and if so, it becomes visible when it has keyboard focus

style_focus_visible.0: The keyboard focus indicator should be visible when default border or outline is modified by CSS
style_focus_visible.potential_focus_not_visible: Check the keyboard focus indicator is visible when using CSS declaration for 'border' or 'outline'

target_spacing_sufficient.0: The target must be sufficiently sized or spaced from other targets
target_spacing_sufficient.violation_spacing: Undersized target "{0}" does not have sufficient spacing of 12 CSS pixels from another target "{1}"

widget_tabbable_single.0: Components with a widget role must have no more than one tabbable element
widget_tabbable_single.potential_multiple_tabbable: Component with "{0}" role has more than one tabbable element

input_label_visible.0: An input element must have an associated visible label
input_label_visible.potential_no_label: The input element does not have an associated visible label
input_label_visible.potential_placeholder_only: The ‘placeholder’ is the only visible label

label_name_visible.0: Accessible name must match or contain the visible label text
label_name_visible.Fail_1: Accessible name does not match or contain the visible label text

text_contrast_sufficient.0: The contrast ratio of text with its background must meet WCAG AA requirements
text_contrast_sufficient.potential_same_color: The foreground text and its background color are both detected as {3}. Verify the text meets the WCAG AA requirements for minimum contrast
text_contrast_sufficient.fail_contrast: Text contrast of {0} with its background is less than the WCAG AA minimum requirements for text of size {1}px and weight of {2}

heading_content_exists.0: Heading elements must provide descriptive text
heading_content_exists.Fail_1: Heading element has no descriptive content

aria_accessiblename_exists.0: Elements with certain roles should have accessible names
aria_accessiblename_exists.fail_no_accessible_name: Element <{0}> with "{1}" role has no accessible name

text_sensory_misuse.0: Instructions should be meaningful without relying solely on shape, size, or location words
text_sensory_misuse.potential_position: Confirm the word(s) '{0}' of the user instruction is used to indicate a logical rather than visual position
text_sensory_misuse.potential_other: Confirm the user instruction is still understandable without the word(s) '{0}'

a_target_warning.0: Users should be warned in advance if their input action will open a new window
a_target_warning.potential_warn: Inform the user when their input action will open a new window

aria_landmark_name_unique.0: Each landmark should have a unique 'aria-labelledby' or 'aria-label' or be nested in a different parent region
aria_landmark_name_unique.Fail_0: Multiple elements with "{0}" landmarks within the same parent region are not distinguished from one another because they have the same "{1}" label
